info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 12:20PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...HAZARDOUS SHOWERS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BERKELEY COUNTY... ...MARINERS ON LAKE MOULTRIE AND EASTERN LAKE MARION SHOULD SEEK SAFE HARBOR... At 1217 PM EST, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated showers with gusty winds along a line extending from near Salters to near Harleyville, and moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph possible with a sudden wind shift into the northwest. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of these showers include... Moncks Corner, Saint Stephen, Bonneau, Southern Lake Moultrie, Eadytown, Cross, Northern Lake Moultrie and Bonneau Beach. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Boaters on Lake Moultrie and the eastern portions of Lake Marion should seek safe harbor immediately. If caught on the open water, stay as low as possible and wear a personal flotation device. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
